title: 2-year-old firing rifle injures 4-month-old sibling, CPS investigating
content:
MUSKEGON COUNTY, MI -- A 4-month-old girl had only minor injuries after police say her 2-year-old brother fired several rounds from a rifle he found in a closet of a Dalton Township home.
The infant had a graze wound to an arm and was treated and released from a hospital.
Child Protective Services investigators are looking into the shooting, police say.
Rescuers were called about 7 p.m. Thursday, Oct. 13 to a home in the 300 block of E. Calumet Avenue in Lakewood Club.
Police initially thought the girl had been struck by a pellet from a shotgun in the house, but later determined the 2-year-old was responsible.
Police said the boy managed to remove a .22-caliber rifle from a closet and fire several rounds. One round struck the 4-month-old girl.
Deputies seized the rifle.
The mother of the children was home when the shooting happened, police said.
Muskegon County Sheriff Dean Roesler said a report will be sent to Muskegon County prosecutors for review.
"This incident underscores the dangers of having a loaded weapon in the home that is not secured. I urge all gun owners to follow all safety suggestions including never having a loaded weapon unsecured and within reach of children," Roesler said.
